summary: This is an email exchange from April 2011 between an FBI Special Agent and a conference director. The FBI agent is investigating whether Jeffrey Epstein attended the New Orleans Investment Conference between 1998-2000 and is requesting information about conference hotels from that period.

persons.name: Adele Thonn
persons.context: Conference Director for Jefferson Financial, Inc., responding to FBI inquiries about the New Orleans Investment Conference hotels from 1998-2000 and checking records for Epstein's attendance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named by the FBI agent as one of two individuals whose attendance at the New Orleans Investment Conference between 1998-2000 is being investigated.

connections.description: FBI Special Agent Jo is investigating Jeffrey Epstein's potential attendance at a financial conference in New Orleans.
FBI agent contacting conference director for information about Epstein's potential conference attendance.

events.title: New Orleans Investment Conference 1998
events.description: Conference event located at Hyatt Regency, New Orleans; also used Windsor Court for sleeping rooms.

events.title: New Orleans Investment Conference 1999
events.description: Conference event and sleeping rooms at Hyatt Regency, New Orleans.

events.title: New Orleans Investment Conference 2000
events.description: Conference event located at Sheraton New Orleans; also used Windsor Court for sleeping rooms.

events.title: FBI Inquiry About Epstein Conference Attendance
events.description: FBI Special Agent contacts conference director to determine if Jeffrey Epstein attended New Orleans Investment Conference between 1998-2000.

locations: 505 Flagler Dr. Ste. 500 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The FBI was investigating Jeffrey Epstein's potential attendance at the New Orleans Investment Conference between 1998-2000 as of April 2011.
The FBI agent specifically named Jeffrey Epstein as one of two individuals whose conference attendance was being investigated.
Conference records from 1998-2000 showed events at Hyatt Regency and Sheraton New Orleans hotels, with Windsor Court used for sleeping rooms.
The conference director noted that paper records had been destroyed and computer databases had been transitioned, making verification difficult.
This document shows FBI investigative activity regarding Epstein's movements and activities approximately 11 years after the time period in question.
